text:
Sixth Avenue, from W. 50th to 51st Streets. View No. 1 is south from 51st Street and shows the old car- barn on the west side of this frontage. This was de- molished. The site provides a vantage point for the additional views. There the view point is respectively southeast and north east; the station being at 50th St. Beyond same is the future Rockefeller Center site. Under construction is the Grand Central Building.

October 22, 1927
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

West 50th Street, north side, east from a point midway between Seventh and Sixth Aves., and across the latter. Shown under demolition is the southeastern corner of the New York Railways Company plant and barn which occupied the entire block. The low structures east of Sixth Ave. (Elevated station thereon) have gone and today (1937), units of Radio City stand thereon. Note the twin spires of St. Patricks Cathedral in the background. This set consists of a negative and a positive.

March 23, 1928.

F. M. Demarest.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.

50th Street, east from but not including Sixth Ave.
September 28, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

South on Sixth Avenue from roof between 50th and 51st Street. September 14, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

Sixth Avenue, east side, from W. 50th to 51st Streets, showing the Rockefeller Center excavation. Upon this portion of the same will rise the 31 story R. K. O. Building and its adjoining 8 story International Music Hall. The northbound platform of the 50th Street station of the Sixth Ave. "El" is in the foreground. The photographer is viewing eastward across the same from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue.
September 14, 1931.
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, east side, from W. 50th to 51st Streets, showing the Rockefeller Center excavation. Upon this portion of the same will rise the 31 story R. K. O. Building and its adjoining 8 story International Music Hall. The northbound platform of the 50th Street station of the Sixth Ave. "El" is in the foreground. The photographer is viewing eastward across the same from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue.
September 14, 1931.
Views 1, 2, 3

The photographer is viewing eastward across the same from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue.
September 14, 1931.
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr

(1)
Excavation work in progress. Other buildings at the extreme edge of the excavation, will eventually be demolished.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same. Also shown on the extreme right, is the "Corsettiers," No. 42 West 50th Street, still standing.
July 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)

Sixth Avenue, east side, at West 50th Street (center of View 1) showing the Rockefeller Center clearance that extends from 48th to 51st Streets. The photographer is viewing eastward from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue. Fifth Avenue forms the distant edge of this huge building site.

September 14, 1931
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, east side, at West 50th Street (center of View 1) showing the Rockefeller Center clearance that extends from 48th to 51st Streets. The photographer is viewing eastward from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue. Fifth Avenue forms the distant edge of this huge building site.

September 14, 1931
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

(1) West 50th Street, east from Sixth Ave., as viewed from 49th Street, and showing mainly the demolition in progress at the S.W. corner of Fifth Ave.

June 14, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, slightly later. Note the twin spires of St. Patrick's Cathedral, across the roof of Brill Bros., Building (Fifth Ave., at the N.W. corner of 50th Street).

June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, a more extensive view, at a later date, and showing complete demolition.

September 7, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

50th Street, east from but not including Sixth Ave. The View shows Fifth Ave, east side, from 49th to 50th Streets, and 49th Street, from and including Fifth Ave, east to but not including Madison Ave. In the foreground is seen the excavation for one of
the Radio City buildings.
March 18, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.
The same, showing only the south side of 50th Street, eastward. Note the unfinished tower of the Waldorf Astoria Hotel.
June 28, 1931.

(1) West 50th Street, east from, but not including Sixth Ave. Building shown standing at No. 42 West 50th Street, was occupied by a corset-tier, and was finally demolished after much litigation.

July 23, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) Rear and side views of No. 42.

June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

72-66 West 50th Street, (rear view) adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Sixth Ave.
June 28, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

INTERNATIONAL MUSIC HALL
R.K.O. BLDG. - SCULPTURE OVER ENTRANCE
11/5/32

(1) 1260-1272 Sixth Ave., east side, between West 50th and 51st Streets. This is the site of the R.K.O. Building, which is shown in this view in the process of construction. Photographers viewpoint was from 10 West 49th Street, northward. January 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from the doorway at Nos. 42-46 West 48th Street. February 14, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The completed 31-story R.K.O. Building. The low 8-story structure at its rear is the International Music Hall. Note Sixth Ave. cutting a diagonal across the face of the view and the 50th Street station of its elevated line. August 9, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) 1260-1272 Sixth Ave., east side, between West 50th and 51st Streets. This is the site of the R.K.O. Building, which is shown in this view in the process of construction. Photographers viewpoint was from 10 West 49th Street, northward. January 24, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from the doorway at Nos. 42-46 West 48th Street. February 14, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The completed 31-story R.K.O. Building. The low 8-story structure at its rear is the International Music Hall. Note Sixth Ave. cutting a diagonal across the face of the view and the 50th Street station of its elevated line. August 9, 1933.

(1) West 50th Street, north side, east from Sixth Ave., and showing both demolition at the N.W. corner of Fifth Ave., and construction at the S.W. corner of the same Ave., at 51st Street. Thru both appears St. Patrick's Cathedral, which is on the east side of Fifth Ave., between 50th and 51st Streets. October 22, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, slightly eastward. The other prominent building shown, is the General Electric, located on Lexington Ave., at the S.W. corner of East 51st Street. October 22, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as No. 2. October 22, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

Rockefeller Plaza: Structural detail of the R.K.O. Bldg. and the rock supporting West 50th Street, as viewed from the excavation for the dominant R.C.A. Bldg.

1933

Bernice Abbott

144-136 West 50th Street, south side, between Seventh and Sixth Aves.
March 20, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

West 50th Street, north side, between Sixth and Seventh Aves., showing the automobile parking space, as it extends northward to West 52nd, after crossing West 51st Streets. In the background (left to right) appear the 45-story Essex House, the 36-story Hampshire House, and the 40-story Barbizon-Plaza, respectively, Nos. 160 and 170, 150, and 106 Central Park South, between Seventh and Sixth Aves.
March 30, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

W. 50th Street, east from a point to the west of Sixth Avenue and showing units of Rockefeller City, beyond a station of the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line. The 70 storied R.C.A. Building is to the right and to the left, Radio City Music Hall. At this date subway construction is proceeding as evidenced by the detail shown at the corners. In February 1939 the "El" will be removed.

May 3, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing various aspects of the about to be demolished "El" structure at Rockefeller (Radio) City.

View No. 1 is a reversed print from a negative showing a southeastward view towards the R.C.A. Building from the west side of the Avenue above 50th Street.

No. 2 is northward on the east side of this thoroughfare showing the stairs at the S.E. corner.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm. Herries

Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing various aspects of the about to be demolished "El" structure at Rockefeller (Radio) City.

View No. 1 is a reversed print from a negative showing a southeastward view towards the R.C.A. Building from the west side of the Avenue above 50th Street.

No. 2 is northward on the east side of this thoroughfare showing the stairs at the S.E. corner.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm. Herries

Sixth Avenue, at W. 50th Street, showing the northbound "El" platform extension; a result of the construction of Rockefeller Center. The photographer is at the N.E. corner and is viewing westward. The buildings shown are at the N.W. corner.

March, 1939

Wm. Herries

Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing the tracks and the uptown station of the "El", prior to demolition. These photographs are taken from the downtown platform and feature the opposite side.

Buildings forming the background are on the east side of this thoroughfare and extend northward. The Radio City Music Hall is in the R.K.O. Building which occupies the 50th-51st Street frontage. View No. 2 shows a train of wooden cars making its last run uptown.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm. Herries

Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing the tracks and the uptown station of the "El", prior to demolition. These photographs are taken from the downtown platform and feature the opposite side.

Buildings forming the background are on the east side of this thoroughfare and extend northward. The Radio City Music Hall is in the R.K.O. Building which occupies the 50th-51st Street frontage. View No. 2 shows a train of wooden cars making its last run uptown.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm. Herries

Sixth Avenue, south from West 51st Street, showing the Sixth Avenue "El", a portion of its 50th Street station and units of Rockefeller City. That on the left (containing the Radio City Music Hall) is the R.K. O. Building. To the right is the rear structure of the towering (70 stories) R.C.A. Building. These buildings occupy the 51st - 50th and 50th-49th Street frontages respectively.

The photographer is viewing southeastward from the N.W. corner of Sixth Avenue and West 51st St. in both instances.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm. Herries

View 1, D7 : Neg. # 4097

Sixth Avenue, south from West 51st Street, showing the Sixth Avenue "El", a portion of its 50th Street station and units of Rockefeller City. That on the left (containing the Radio City Music Hall) is the R.K. O. Building. To the right is the rear structure of the towering (70 stories) R.C.A. Building. These buildings occupy the 51st - 50th and 50th-49th Street frontages respectively.

The photographer is viewing southeastward from the N.W. corner of Sixth Avenue and West 51st St. in both instances.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm. Herries

View 1, D7 : Neg. # 4097

50th St. W. of 6th Ave. Neg. A-179 July 15, 1941
Remodeling Waldorf Theatre
P.L. Sperr

View 1;and 2 Same.
West 50th Street. South side between Seventh and Sixth Avenues looking eastwards showing Waldorf Theater and Gypsy Sandwich Shop, Rockefeller buildings in background.
February 11, 1941.
View 3;
231-233 west 50th Street, north side west of Broadway near Capitol Theater showing the plot where two story buildings were raised.
P.L.Speer.
Match 4, 1939.
